SEARCH
Package uk.ac.aber.cs21120.knockout.interfaces

Interface IGroupMatch

All Known Implementing Classes:
GroupMatch
public interface IGroupMatch
Interface for a single match between two teams. The match may or may not have been played. Objects implementing this interface must have a constructor which takes two teams, e.g. GroupMatch(ITeam team1, ITeam team2)

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    ITeam

    Return the number of points team 1 has scored from this match.

  • Method Details

    • getTeam1

      ITeam getTeam1()
      Returns:
      the first of the two teams in this match

    • getTeam2

      ITeam getTeam2()
      Returns:
      the second of the two teams in this match

    • isPlayed

      boolean isPlayed()
      Returns:
      true if the match has been played, false otherwise

    • setScore

      void setScore(int team1Score, int team2Score)
      Set the score for this match. After this, isPlayed() should return true. Note that once the scores are set we cannot retrieve or change them - we can only retrieve the points.
      Parameters:
      team1Score - the score for team 1
      team2Score - the score for team 2
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the match has already been played

    • getTeam1Points

      int getTeam1Points()
      Return the number of points team 1 has scored from this match. If team 1 scored more goals, they won the match and get 3 points. If the match was a draw, both teams get 1 point. If team 2 scored more goals, team 1 gets 0 points.
      Returns:
      the number of points team 1 has scored from this match. Returns zero if the match has not been played.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the match has not been played

    • getTeam2Points

      int getTeam2Points()
      Return the number of points team 2 has scored from this match. If team 2 scored more goals, they won the match and get 3 points. If the match was a draw, both teams get 1 point. If team 1 scored more goals, team 2 gets 0 points.
      Returns:
      the number of points team 2 has scored from this match. Returns zero if the match has not been played.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the match has not been played
